newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Sonae sees lower extraordinaries in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Sonae sees lower extraordinaries in 1996.

text.p: Retail to wood products group Sonae Investimentos sees extraordinary earnings of 5.6 billion escudos ($36.2 million) in 1996, down from 8.3 billion the previous year.
The company said on Monday it expected full-year profit to rise to 13.9 billion escudos this year from 12.9 billion in 1995.
The extraordinaries would be generated by the sale of real estate interests, the group said.

Sonae Imobiliaria, its real estate arm, is negotiating the sale of 50 percent of its holding in shopping centre Cascaishoping in a deal that would earn the group some 1.8 billion escudos in book profit, Sonae Investimentos executive board member Edgar Pinto Ribeiro told journalists.
The stake is being bought by Pricoa, a European subsidiary of the U.S. Prudential Insurance. Pricoa would also be taking a stake in Gaiashopping, another shopping centre owned by Sonae.
The group said that it expects Sonae Imobiliaria to boost profit in 1996 by 400 percent to 2.7 billion escudos.
Overall sales were seen rising 185 percent to 15.7 billion, due to the property sales. Turnover rose 65 percent to 3.8 billion over the first six months.
